benchmark_details.name: MedAlign
benchmark_details.overview: MedAlign is a benchmark dataset of 983 natural language instructions for electronic health record (EHR) data, curated by clinicians, to address the documentation burdens faced by healthcare providers. It includes clinician-written responses and allows for evaluation of large language models (LLMs) on realistic text generation tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark dataset for evaluating LLMs on clinician-relevant tasks utilizing EHRs.

data.source: Curated from natural language instructions provided by clinicians across various specialties paired with EHRs.
data.annotation: Clinicians wrote reference responses based on instruction-EHR pairs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of LLM responses compared to clinician-generated gold standard answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in following clinician instructions and generating appropriate responses.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 (32k) achieved 60.1% accuracy in its responses.
methodology.validation: Evaluated by clinicians ranking LLM responses against reference answers.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Subset of data analyzed for potential biases in LLM performance across different demographic factors.
targeted_risks.harm: LLM errors could lead to poor clinical decision-making and compromise patient safety.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data was de-identified using a ‘hiding in plain sight’ protocol.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Patients provided consent for their medical records to be used for research.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Conducted in accordance with HIPAA and institutional review board guidelines.
